properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain over northernmost Manitoba tonight and into Saturday. A weather system approaching from Saskatchewan will continue to bring a mix of precipitation to northernmost Manitoba tonight and Saturday. The phase of the precipitation will vary over the area and over time. Generally areas to the south will be either rain or freezing rain, while areas towards the Nunavut border will be snow mixed with freezing rain. Milder air will push through the area early Saturday ending the freezing rain. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Utility outages may occur. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T12:37:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T20:38:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3000480675.2020
Area: Brochet, Tadoule Lake, Churchill, York
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain over northern Manitoba today and tonight. A weather system approaching from Saskatchewan will continue to bring a mix of precipitation to northern Manitoba today. An area of freezing rain over northernmost Manitoba will continue to move towards Nunavut throughout the day, and will affect the Churchill region tonight. Temperatures have risen above freezing in the Thompson, Gillam, and Shamattawa regions. Freezing rain amounts of 5 to 15 mm are expected with the higher amounts occurring towards the Saskatchewan border. Some areas in these regions may receive accumulating snow. Easterly winds gusting to 50 to 60 km/h are also forecast. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T10:15:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T18:16:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4287818916.2020
Area: Brochet, Tadoule Lake, Churchill, York
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system over southern BC will bring showers to the region today. Snow levels have lowered to 1200 to 1400 metres this morning and is forecast to rise to near 1700 metres this afternoon. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are expected this morning over highway 3 - Paulson summit to Kootenay Pass and over the Okanagan Connector. Lesser amounts of 2 to 4 cm are possible over Allison Pass and Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T03:39:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T11:40:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3003739812.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass, Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt, Okanagan Connector - Merritt to Kelowna
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system approaching from the prairies will bring snow then freezing rain to Arviat Saturday. The freezing rain will ease late Saturday but some freezing drizzle is likely to persist Saturday night. ### Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T11:25:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T19:26:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3922355254.2020
Area: Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: northwesterly 100 km/h. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik, and Cartwright to Black Tickle. Time span: overnight tonight until Saturday morning. Remarks: The strongest wind gusts will be over exposed coastal areas. Additionally, with periods of snow forecast to accompany these strong winds, poor visibilities in blowing snow can be expected at times. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-23T10:43:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T18:44:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0320279672.2020
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: minus 1 to plus 3. Locations: central northern and eastern Nova Scotia including Cape Breton Island. Time span: overnight and early Saturday morning. Remarks: A combination of clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for patchy frost formation tonight. These conditions will likely occur again Saturday night and early Sunday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T10:59:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T19:23:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2537813455.2020

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. Freezing rain is expected to continue this morning. A band of freezing rain is expected to sit over northeastern Saskatchewan this morning. This freezing rain will end this afternoon when warmer air moves into the area and changes the precipitation over to rain. ### Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T22:29:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T10:33:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4203733422.2020
Area: Cree Lake - Key Lake, Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay, Southend - Brabant Lake - Kinoosao

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms are developing along a cold front in southwestern Manitoba this afternoon. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. Thunderstorm activity will taper off later this evening. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T07:02:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T20:14:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1117220742.2020

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain over northern Manitoba today and tonight. A weather system approaching from Saskatchewan will continue to bring a mix of precipitation to northern Manitoba today. An area of freezing rain over northernmost Manitoba will continue to move towards Nunavut throughout the day, and will affect the Churchill region this evening. The freezing rain has ended in the Lynn Lake region. The freezing rain continues north of the communities of Thompson and Gillam. Freezing rain amounts of 5 to 15 mm are expected with the higher amounts occurring towards the Saskatchewan border. Some areas in these regions may receive accumulating snow. Easterly winds gusting to 50 to 60 km/h are also forecast. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T06:29:29-00:00

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Some plants may be damaged or even destroyed by frost. Frost and freeze conditions will develop tonight as temperatures fall to near freezing. Frost will occur in some areas again Saturday night into Sunday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T11:36:23-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:56 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is near Crandall and is moving north at 30 km/h. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-05-22T23:55:27-00:00

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Minimum temperatures: minus 1 to plus 4. Locations: northern and southeastern New Brunswick. Time span: overnight and early Saturday morning. Remarks: Patchy frost is expected to form tonight as clear skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures, especially in low lying areas. Favourable conditions for frost will occur again Saturday night and Sunday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T11:22:27-00:00
